description.value:
You weave an armor for yourself through your spellcraft, depicting what you are wearing as if it was an archmage’s enchanted robes or a knight’s valiant armor. You gain a +3 item bonus to your AC and a maximum dexterity modifier of +2. While you are surrounded by your coat of paint, you use your unarmored proficiency to calculate your AC.

You can eschew spending an ephemeral catalyst by spending a focus point. If you do, you can target yourself or another creature within 30 feet of you to gain this spell’s benefits, and this spell lasts 1 minute and takes 3 actions to cast.

@UUID[Compendium.immortal-ardor.classes.TzLVMkzODl93LsSf]{Spell Effect: Coat of Paint}

Heightened (4th) You gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

Heightened (6th) The item bonus to AC increases to +4 and you gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

Heightened (8th) The item bonus to AC increases to +4 and you gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

Heightened (10th) The item bonus to AC increases to +5 and you gain a +3 item bonus to saving throws.
